page.title: 16The Bluebell Railway
page.content: The Bluebell Railway runs for five miles between the stations at Horsted Keynes and Sheffield Park. The line was first opened in 1882, but B.R. closed it in 1958 because it was not used much. It was reopened as the Bluebell line in the 1960s to keep old steam trains running. It now carries nearly 100 000 passengers a year. They come to see the engines and visit the stations and to travel through the beautiful countryside near our village. Children from our school sometimes visit the railway and some of them made a television film there. Lots of films are made on the famous Bluebell Railway. I like the railway because I like the old trains, and the way the sun glitters and reflects off the metal engines. They are very old but they look new and shiney.
